title: 115_s371
content: The Act titled "Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017, Improvements Act" makes amendments to the Omnibus Diplomatic Security and Antiterrorism Act of 1986 and requires annual reports on embassy construction costs to be submitted to the appropriate congressional committees. The Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017, makes amendments regarding oversight of peacekeeper abuses, workforce rightsizing report, and consular immunity. Congressional committees are involved in the oversight and accountability processes. The Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017, is amended to include the Committee on Appropriations in oversight roles for foreign relations and drug policy. Additionally, peacekeeping training procedures are updated to focus on investigating allegations. SEC. 4 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 to update peacekeeping training procedures by focusing on investigating allegations and holding personnel accountable for their actions. It also revises qualifications for the United Nations Secretary General. SEC. 5 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 regarding the United Nations Human Rights Council, specifying criteria for countries designated as Tier 3 in the Trafficking in Persons Report. SEC. 6 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 to include a comparative report on peacekeeping operations, detailing costs incurred by the United States for United Nations peacekeeping operations. SEC. 7 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 by allowing lateral entry into the Foreign Service. SEC. 8 changes the section heading of section 419 to combat intolerance instead of anti-semitism. SEC. 9 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 by making technical corrections regarding the Western Hemisphere Drug Policy Commission report. Members of the Commission will serve without pay or benefits. SEC. 10 makes a technical correction regarding the powers of the Western Hemisphere Drug Policy Commission, allowing them to solicit, accept, and use gifts, bequests, and devises for their purpose. SEC. 11 amends the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 by removing references to significant restructuring in the Broadcasting Board of Governors. SEC. 12 amends the Act by adding the phrase "to the extent practicable" before "transmit" in relation to ransoms to foreign terrorist organizations. SEC. 13 further amends the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 regarding the restoration of the Tibet report. The text chunk discusses the requirement for the President to provide periodic reports on the implementation of the Tibetan Policy Act of 2002 and the status of discussions between China and the Dalai Lama or his representatives. This requirement is outlined in the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017. The Department of State must provide reports on the Tibetan Policy Act of 2002 to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Foreign Relations, as outlined in the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
